info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued January 14 at 2:35PM EST until January 14 at 3:15PM EST by NWS Albany
info.description: The National Weather Service in Albany has issued a * Snow Squall Warning for... Eastern Schenectady County in east central New York... North central Columbia County in east central New York... Albany County in east central New York... Northeastern Greene County in east central New York... Southern Saratoga County in east central New York... Rensselaer County in east central New York... * Until 315 PM EST. * At 235 PM EST, a dangerous snow squall was located along a line extending from Country Knolls to 10 miles west of Coxsackie, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Intense bursts of heavy snow. Gusty winds leading to blowing snow and visibility rapidly falling to less than one-quarter mile. Wind gusts greater than 35 mph. SOURCE...Radar and webcams. IMPACT...Travel will become difficult and potentially dangerous within minutes. This includes the following highways... Interstate 88 between exits 24 and 25. Interstate 90 between exits 10 and 26. Interstate 890 between exits 1a and 9. Interstate 87 between exits 21B and 7, and between exits 8A and 11. Interstate 787 between exits 1 and 9. Locations impacted include... Albany, Schenectady, Troy, Clifton Park, Rotterdam, East Greenbush, Cohoes, Watervliet, Rensselaer, Colonie, Scotia, Mechanicville, Hoosick Falls, Chatham, Nassau, Delmar, Latham, Guilderland, Niskayuna, and Duanesburg. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Reduce speed and turn on headlights! During snow squalls, the visibility may suddenly drop to near zero in whiteout conditions. There is no safe place on a highway when a snow squall hits. Visibility and traction are immediately lost in whiteout conditions, making it difficult or impossible to slow down and avoid stopped vehicles. Delay travel or safely exit the highway before the snow squall arrives. SNOW SQUALL...OBSERVED
